meanings.definition: A person or thing that waps.
meanings.sent1: The little wapper ran around the yard happily.
meanings.sent2: I saw a cute wapper at the pet store yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The wapper tried to climb the tree but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: The wapper's laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The colorful wapper danced in the meadow, spreading cheer.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a quick, sharp blow.
meanings.sent1: She wappered the drum with all her might.
meanings.sent2: The chef wappered the dough to make it smooth.
meanings.sent3: The kids wappered the pinata until it burst open.
meanings.sent4: His words wappered her heart, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent5: The wind wappered the leaves off the trees in a whirlwind.

meanings.sent1: The thunder made a loud wapper in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The wapper of the falling tree echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected wapper startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The wapper of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The wapper of the waves against the rocks was soothing.
